intro: Anemone coronaria proles ventreana, commonly known as the ventreana poppy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking, cup-shaped petals that range in color from white to deep red, depending on the variety. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, with hairy stems and lobed leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. The flowers bloom in spring, adding a vibrant splash of color to gardens and natural landscapes.
